meanings.definition: A diagram that depicts family relationships and medical history.
meanings.sent1: The genogram displayed all the family members and their connections.
meanings.sent2: I used a genogram to understand my family's medical background.
meanings.sent3: The genogram revealed a tangled web of relationships and health information.
meanings.sent4: Her family tree was like a genogram, branching out with stories and illnesses.
meanings.sent5: Creating a genogram helped me see the bigger picture of my family's health.

meanings.definition: To create a genogram to visually represent family connections.
meanings.sent1: She decided to genogram her family tree for a school project.
meanings.sent2: We will genogram the family history to better understand our roots.
meanings.sent3: Genogramming the family tree turned out to be quite fun and informative.
meanings.sent4: He genograms every year to keep track of the family's growth and changes.
meanings.sent5: Genogramming allows us to see our family history in a clear and organized way.

meanings.definition: The genogram showed a history of heart disease in the family.
meanings.sent1: The detailed genogram highlighted the prevalence of heart issues in the family.
meanings.sent2: Doctors used the genogram to understand the family's risk factors.
meanings.sent3: The genogram's findings on heart disease surprised everyone at the reunion.
meanings.sent4: The genogram's heart disease patterns were like a roadmap for prevention.
meanings.sent5: The genogram's heart history section was a wake-up call for healthier habits.
